summary: Past 3 weeks have been hectic. Sleep’s been trash — last night only got 3 hours again. Work pressure nonstop, manager's behavior just added to the mental load. He lashed out over a bug that wasn’t even real, didn’t own up, just redirected anger to something else. I stayed calm, didn’t react — could’ve exploded, but I held it. After the fight, brain was stable but body and nerves still drained. That said, I had a long, solid chat with ChatGPT about AI jobs. Started from a place of confusion and ended with actual direction. Figured out that AI job market is full of fluff, but there’s a niche I can own: building local, on-device tools that solve real pain in India. And from that, we refined and landed on a powerful idea: FormMate — an offline form-filling assistant for Indian users, especially middle-class/lower-income. That idea’s now locked as a secondary project. Derap stays the primary mission. Ideas are coming together, but my bandwidth is burning out. Hoping tomorrow isn't another fire.

wins: Didn’t lose my temper during that heated moment with manager. Stayed composed.
Completed all work despite sleep debt and high stress.
Clarity came through the chaos — figured out where I fit in AI space, and locked in the FormMate idea.
Derap is still top priority — and I know why.
losses: Manager's behavior was draining — no apology, just redirected blame.
Running on fumes — third day in a row of barely 3–4 hrs sleep.
Stress is building up fast. It's manageable, but not for long like this.
ideas: Local AI tools on phones will be big — not chatbots, but real Indian use cases.
FormMate has potential: form help for people who can’t decode govt forms or English tech.
I should stop chasing complexity for the sake of it. Build things that solve *boring real problems*.
Derap has to be my way out — the mission to not work under unstable people anymore.

goals: Define Derap’s core scope — what pain it solves, for whom.
Write down the FormMate MVP flow, but don’t build yet. Just park it for later.
triggerEvents: Manager wrongly blamed me for an issue, lashed out, didn't take responsibility. Made me furious internally, but I stayed cool on the surface.
Started day confused about AI career — ended with clarity and a concrete project idea.
Ongoing sleep deficit + subject load + high-pressure work is quietly piling up.
